data.title: About the Team
images: https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-team-images/f02849286f939458-Sasha Ban for Khan Academy Team Page.JPG
https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-team-images/f02849286f939458-Sasha Ban for Khan Academy Team Page.JPG
data.meta_description: Learn for free about math, art, computer programming, economics, physics, chemistry, biology, medicine, finance, history, and more. Khan Academy is a nonprofit with the mission of providing a free, world-class education for anyone, anywhere.
data.text:
Adam

Software Engineer

Adam is a software developer with a passion for building useful and understandable user experiences. Before working at Khan Academy he built software for several companies in the US and Germany.

In his free time, Adam likes to read, play video games, and travel.

Aditya

Ady

Senior Manager - Partner Operations, Khan Academy India

Ady is a tech nerd who leads projects in the Khan Academy India team that help scale the implementation programme with various State government departments. He has worked on creating the Khan Academy Support Hub for Teachers and Administrators in India.

Before joining Khan Academy, Ady has been a Math teacher to students aged 13 and above. He has also spent about 5 years working in the e-commerce sector in various business roles.

Away from work, Ady loves watching sports (Big fan of Liverpool FC), playing video games on his PS5, belting tunes at karaoke bars and tagging along for travel adventures with his wife.

Alan

Sr. Software Engineering Manager

Alan, a 'nurse gone geek,' dedicated years to practicing as a registered nurse before making a significant career shift into the tech industry in 2014. As the founding engineer at a startup, he meticulously refined his technical expertise, deepened his knowledge, and cultivated strong leadership skills. Currently, he leverages these skills while acquiring new ones in his role as a Software Engineering Manager, serving and supporting the Marketing Philanthropy Product team.

Beyond the professional realm, Alan treasures moments spent with his family in Houston, Texas. You'll often find him immersed in books, engrossed in audiobooks, or enjoying video games. He also has a slight addiction to ordering gadgets to solve everyday problems, such as eyes burning while cutting onions.

Amanda

Amanda Campos

International Content Lead

Amanda believes that education is the key to a better future. She loves Khan Academy and is excited about bringing this high-quality content to the world. She leads the international teams responsible for content localization and local content creation.

Amanda has been working in Education for over 10 years. She has experienced many different roles, from educational franchise manager to teacher trainer, as well as being a mentor for teachers and school coordinators. In recent years she had been focusing on course material development, being an editor and member of the R&D department of an EFL publisher and franchiser.

Amanda holds a BA from PUC, an MBA from FGV, a graduate degree in teaching from SENAC, and a graduate degree in technology applied to education from PUC.

Ana Lúcia

Latam District Pedagogy Lead

Ana Lúcia holds a BA in Physics, a Master’s degree in Biophysics and a PhD in Biophysics and Biochemistry from USP. She has been working in Education as a teacher for over 15 years and with teacher training and capacity building since 2008.

When she’s not focused on science content or professional learning, she’s usually playing with her dogs, bicycling, cooking, reading or going to the beach.

Angela

Finance & Accounting Manager

Angela is responsible for day-to-day financial transactions, ensuring that the bills get paid and accounting for all the dollars and cents.

Prior to joining Khan Academy, Angela worked in cash operations at First Republic Trust Company and taught English to children in South Korea. When she is not busy reconciling bank statements, Angela can be found paddling in a canoe or going for a run around the city.

Angela

Production Artist

Angela is a Production Artist on the Khan Academy Kids team. She helps ensure the design quality of the artwork and content going into the Khan Academy Kids app. She is passionate about working on a mission-driven team to help create a free, fun, and educational experience for kids around the world.

When she's not making gifs of the Khan Academy Kids characters, she enjoys film photography, petting cats, and short walks to a coffee shop.

Anthony

IT Administrator

Anthony supports the staff at Khan Academy ensuring the technology is up to date and working reliably.

Before joining Khan Academy he worked in IT for 15 years implementing and supporting technology at public & private schools.

He has a passion for technology that started at an early age and built his first computer to play the latest games.

Learning new tech and solving problems are two things he enjoys. As a hobby he enjoys designing and programming iOS/Android games.

Aryasilpa

Arya

Aryasilpa Adhikari

Senior Philanthropy Manager & Analyst

Aryasilpa is a Development Finance practitioner with 10+ years of cross functional experience in philanthropy, partnership and coalition execution, CSR program design, resource mobilization (commercial and philanthropic capital). She is part of the Philanthropy team of Khan Academy India.She has experience in building & executing high quality partnerships with business stakeholders, philanthropic & commercial donors, private sector and Government bodies for local social and economic development. She is a graduate engineer and has a Masters Degree in Development Management from Indian Institute of Forest Management.

In her free time, she loves to write poems, paint pattachitra, explores forgotten Indian village food, mostly from ancestral kitchens and play basketball. She lives with her husband in New Delhi.

Austin

Product Analyst

Austin's self-stated life goal is to learn everything about everything. Since that might take a while, he's starting with the fun stuff.

Using skills acquired during undergrad at Stanford (game theory and risk aversion, a Masters of Analytics program at Northwestern (predictive algorithms, and a two-year stint as a Data Scientist at Facebook (Python programming, Austin spent a year-long sabbatical perfecting a model that helps him choose which kicker to draft for his fantasy football team. It performs 3% better than the baseline and is likely his crowning achievement.

Candy

Candy Reyes

Legal Counsel

Candy is an in-house counsel providing legal support to the global Khan Academy community. I am a Los Angeles native with a BA in Psychology from CSU, Northridge and JD from Marquette University.

I am also a new mom to a beautiful, intelligent and actively curious daughter, Cheyanne. In my spare time, I love taking her out in the world to explore new adventures and foods. I'm also a huge foodie so I welcome all restaurant recommendations across the globe.

Caro

Carolina Salazar

Caro Salazar

Localization Program Manager

Carolina holds a B.A. in Spanish from UCLA. She has worked in localization for over a decade and she's been interested in education her entire life. Starting her career as a translator, moving into project management and localization, she now works at Khan Academy managing localization, ensuring our content reaches learners all over the world!

Outside of work, Caro enjoys spending time with family (including her two cats, Oliver and Nene, and her dog, Milla), traveling, hiking and cooking.

Caroline

VP of Khan Academy Kids

Caroline Hu Flexer is the vice president of Khan Academy Kids. She leads the team developing Khan Academy Kids, an educational program that is designed to inspire a lifetime of learning and discovery for children ages two to eight. The app includes interactive and original content across early literacy, language, math, and social-emotional skills.

Prior to Khan Academy, Caroline was the CEO and cofounder of Duck Duck Moose, which joined Khan Academy in 2016. Duck Duck Moose is the creator of 21 award-winning educational apps for children that have been downloaded over 100 million times. Before Duck Duck Moose, Caroline worked in product management and as a design consultant at IDEO.

Caroline has an AB in architecture from Princeton, attended the masters in architecture program at the Harvard Graduate School of Design, and has an MBA from Stanford.

Cat

Catherine

Senior Frontend Engineer

Hello! My name is Cat, yes I do love cats, and I am a Senior Frontend Engineer on the LEMS team! During my day job I work mostly on React web components and focus on Accessible Technology. On my off hours I love talking about how to create more accessible and inclusive web applications and hosting a podcast discussing new technology creating positive social impact in our world today. I firmly believe technology can be used to create a more inclusive and equitable world as long as we keep it in check.

Cat

Software Engineer

Cat has a degree in Psychology, and taught ESL in South Korea and worked in Special Education before beginning to study software engineering as a hobby. Working at Khan Academy allows her to develop her passion for software and continuous learning while still giving back to students.

Cat’s other interests include reading and listening to audiobooks, going on outdoor adventures with family and friends, picking up new hobby projects, and sometimes even finishing them.

Charlie

Charlotte

Auen

Charlotte Auen

Charlie Auen

Principal Math Content Creator

Charlie is an educator at heart and in practice. They thrive on the moments when a learner (of any age) catches on to a pattern or understands why something works. They bring empathy and content knowledge from K-12 classroom teaching together with evidence-based practices to meet the needs of Khan Academy's learners. Charlie advocates for accessibility and for removing barriers to equity.

When Charlie isn't creating math content or analyzing learning data for Khan Academy, they're dancing folklórico, worshipping with their local Deaf church, or working to make their community a safer place for marginalized folks.

Chelsea

National District Sales Representative

Chelsea is a sales rep by day and Nextflix film critic by night. She spent eight years teaching grades spanning from preschool to sixth grade. She is passionate about supporting equity in classrooms and loves connecting with educators!

She lives in sunny California with her husband and they enjoy exploring new places in their free time. She hopes to one day visit all the national parks; currently Glacier National park is her favorite!

Crystal

Compensation and Benefits Manager

Crystal strategizes and leads total rewards programs to help the Khan Team be their best selves.

Outside of work, Crystal can be found spending time chasing after her toddler and attempting to train her husband to be a better Instagram husband. She enjoys going on photowalks, traveling, exotic birds, cooking recipes from NY Times, looking at art and design aesthetics, and gardening.

Danielle

Senior Regional Sales Manager, Northeast

Danielle Sullivan is an unshakeable optimist who has dedicated over two decades to transforming classrooms worldwide. Danielle has experienced many aspects of education, from working on educational policy on Capitol Hill, to serving students as a middle school special education teacher and in the past 10 years, working in EdTech. Danielle is all about infusing the magic of human connection, the art of learning, and a healthy dose of humor into her mission of inspiring educators to forge strong bonds with both themselves and their students. As the Senior Northeast Sales Manager at Khan Academy, she channels that same energy and enthusiasm to champion Khan's Academy’s mission of providing a free world class education to all, regardless of location or circumstance. Outside her passions for education, she balances sunshine in St. Petersburg, Florida, and cool retreats in Upstate NY, enjoying travel, biking, beach days, hiking, reading, family time, and the occasional improv comedy gig.

Dave

Director of US Content

Before joining Khan Academy in 2016, Dave ran a test prep and college counseling firm in New York, and worked with students all over the world. He led the development of our SAT, LSAT, and Praxis Core prep offerings, and now is thrilled to have the privilege of serving and supporting the entire US Content team. He loves to work with Khan Academy's cross-functional teams of educators, instructional designers, and other creative problem-solvers, and is passionate about empowering our learners to build their confidence and achieve their goals with content that is warm, rigorous and candid, and inspiring.

David

Grammar, English Language Arts, History, and Test Prep Content Specialist

David loves language, and his goal at Khan Academy to present traditionally dry or intimidating topics as fun and approachable.

To do this, he leans on his training: David has a B.A. in English Literature and Film Studies, and he's a trained voice actor and sound designer with years of experience hosting and making podcasts and short films.

Originally from Chicago, David now lives in Washington, D.C. with his wife and their dog. There, they enjoy visiting museums, going on hikes in the Virginia Piedmont, and having marvelous food adventures. He is the author of over a dozen books for children, some of which are available on the Khan Kids app!

Donna Fig

Donna Figenshu

Donna Fig

Fig

Content Creator

Donna (FKA Ms. Fig) creates chemistry content at Khan Academy. She uses her previous 12 years of teaching in Chicago to build content that is relevant and accessible to all of our learners. She is intrigued by concepts that provide explanatory and predictive power, such as those underlying weather patterns or how the brain learns.

Now in Oakland, CA, she enjoys exploring the city and surrounding nature, playing basketball, soccer, gardening, building, hanging out/in with good food, good music, and good friends!

Elly

Elvira Valdez

Content Creator, Financial Literacy

Elly has a math degree, a business degree, and a knack for teaching. She taught high school students in charter and public schools for more than 16 years, but also worked in financial advising for four years. Now she's bringing her skills and enthusiasm to Khan Academy, where she creates engaging and informative content on financial literacy. She was born in Bosnia, but has called Texas home for 25 years. She enjoys embroidery and archery, especially when her son is competing. She's sharp as an arrow.

Emilee

Emilee is a self-professed math content geek who has had the joy and privilege of being in the field of education for 29 years, and counting! She was a middle and high school math teacher across 5 states for 18 years before transitioning into school, region, and national math leadership. She coached and led professional learning for teachers and leaders in her roles at Explore Schools, KIPP NYC and the KIPP Foundation, then built the Learning Experience Design team from the ground up at Great Minds. Now, she is the thrilled to be the Senior Manager of Assessment Content at Khan Academy.

Emilee believes that to be a "math person" you just need to be a person and do math, and has a passion for helping students, teachers, and educational leaders develop - or evolve - their identities as confident mathematical thinkers. A big part of that is leveraging the logical and spectacular progression of mathematics learning, and as part of the assessment team at Khan Academy, she loves getting to dig deep into and shine a bright light on math content every day. She is an enthusiastic supporter of the Clemson Tigers, and shares her life with her college sweetheart and two sweet and spunky cats.

Emily

International Districts Lead

Emily Goldman is Khan Academy's International Districts Lead and is passionate about providing educational experiences that transform learners’ lives. She works with global partners to bring Khan Academy into school classrooms across the world.

Prior to Khan Academy, Emily spent several years managing and evaluating education programs for universities, UN agencies, and humanitarian aid organizations across the Middle East, US, and Latin America. She later led portfolios of policy evaluations at the Puerto Rico Department of Education and at UC Berkeley’s Global Policy Lab. In her free time, Emily loves being outdoors and all things related to music.

Erica

Director, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Belonging

Erica came to Khan Academy as Director, DEIB, with over 20 years of experience working in many facets of education. She is passionate about setting young people up for success and meeting people where they are. As a professional in the realm of belonging, she loves getting to know people and what makes them tick.

Erica's hobbies include puzzles, finding DIY projects to do around her home, and watching television. She also loves to spend time outside.

Ghislaine

Head of Partnerships Latam

Ghis dreams that all students use Khan Academy to access a better world-class education. Therefore, she works building alliances with the public and private sector, encouraging schools to use the platform as a useful tool for teachers.

Before joining Khan Academy, Ghis worked in the Ministry of Education and NGOs in Peru, had a Master degree in UPF Barcelona and participated in the Global Competitiveness Leadership Program in Georgetown University and in the Women Emerging Leaders in London School of Economics.

Hung

Senior Quality Engineer

Hung has more than 17 years of experience in software quality assurance. Passionate and dedicated to releasing quality products, he is super excited to be part of Khan Academy and help give back to the community. He recently learned that his niece is actually using Khan Academy to prep for her SAT test. Prior to Khan Academy, Hung was a champion for product quality at LinkedIn for nearly 8 years. Outside of work, Hung enjoys spending time with his first baby boy and family,,followed by running, cycling and sipping on a cup of Philz coffee.

Ioana

Security Engineer

Ioana works on the security team, helping to keep Khan Academy's learners safe. She first interned at Khan Academy in 2017, then came back for another internship the following summer, and finally joined full-time in 2019!

Prior to joining Khan Academy, she studied Combinatorics & Optimization and Philosophy at the University of Waterloo. Outside of work, you'll probably find her either baking or eating baked goods.

Jake

Jake Englund

Senior Site Reliability Engineer

As an SRE, Jake's mission is to cultivate systemic resiliency: the ability to recover from a wide variety of unexpected failures. While that's typically related to code (what it does and how/why it changes over time), SREs care deeply about what people do and how/why they do it, too! When he's not dancing, swimming, baking pizza, or digging through code, you can probably find him in Etheirys playing his Lalafell Sage+Summoner, Lyll.

Jeff

Senior Software Engineer

Jeff wrote his first program when he was ten. His aim is to make things easy to get right and hard to get wrong.

Jeff is based out of Austin, TX, where he lives with his cat, Barry. When not writing code, Jeff enjoys playing videogames, writing songs, and talking about going to the gym soon.

Jenny

Jenny is a technical prompt engineer on the content team. Before Khan Academy, Jenny conducted design research on learning technologies at Stanford, built software for teachers and students at Replit and UC Irvine, and taught computer science at the high school, community college, and undergraduate level. She cares a lot about making CS personally meaningful for all.

A perfect Saturday afternoon for Jenny would be listening to a podcast on public transit in a new neighborhood.

Jeremy

Software Engineer

Jeremy is elated to contribute to Khan Academy as a Software Engineer after having worked elsewhere in a variety of software engineering, QA, and support roles. He's lived about half his life in Montana and the other approximate half in Florida, where he currently resides with his wife and two dogs. Aside from spending time with family and friends, Jeremy's favorite non-work activity is to hit things while repeatedly counting to small integers. (He's been drumming for 25 years and counting!)

Jessica

Employee Experience Manager

A licensed mental health clinician with a passion and appreciation for the interconnectedness of technology and education, Jessica brings "blue" energy to the People Operations team. The calm in chaos, she supports the whole person, as Khan Academy's DEIB Employee Experience Manager.

Jessica proclaims to be undefeated in Scrabble vs. her husband and enjoys chasing after her two kids when she's not scanning the aisles of thrift stores, tuned in to an audiobook.

Joelle

Illustrator

Joelle works on Khan Academy Kids as an illustrator for the in app books.

She is passionate about character design and illustration for mediums such as film, video games, books, and comics. She also has a love for dance, which she believes brings a unique point of view as she works! Along with dance, she finds inspiration among pastel colors, circus arts, astrology, and confectionaries (especially ice cream, which all make their way into her work in some form or another.

She considers the characters in KA Kids to be her children.

Jordan

Head of Community Giving

Jordan knows that people want to change the world. She heads up Community Giving so that more people can be part of our collective effort to provide a world class education for anyone, anywhere.

Prior to joining Khan Academy she was saving the world in a variety of ways and roles at The Nature Conservancy. She also has faint memories of years in public relations and communications for technology companies. She’s an addicted hiker and backpacker, intrepid traveler, serious shoe collector and strictly amateur wildlife spotter.

Kami

Senior Content Creator, Math

Originally from Las Vegas, NV, Kami joined the Khan Academy math team in 2018 from Erie, PA. She received her B.A. in Political Science and Psychology at Allegheny College and received her M.A. in Education from University of Colorado.

Before joining the Khan team, Kami was a teacher and instructional coach in the elementary grades in Colorado and Philadelphia. Kami enjoys spending time with her family, traveling, and spending time with her daughters.

Karla

Learners Fund Manager

Karla believes in the power of education to change lives. At Khan Academy she is able to partner with supporters who share that belief to help secure the funding that enables a free, world-class education for anyone, anywhere.

Prior to joining Khan Academy, Karla spent time in college access and teaching. She’s an avid traveler who is always planning her next solo trip and an active volunteer in her community. You’ll often find her coaching aspiring first-generation college students or participating in local initiatives aimed at creating a more equitable society.

Katie

Marketing Specialist

Katie is marketing specialist with the Consumer Marketing team who joined Khan Academy after spending one year as a contractor. Her actual Khan journey began when she was a sophomore in high school, studying for her Chemistry course. During her free time you can find her reading a good book, spending time with her family, and playing with her cats. She also loves to travel and explore new places.

Kelli

Head of Data Insights

Kelli is a research scientist who is passionate about solving problems by gathering and analyzing data. Prior to joining Khan Academy, Kelli spent 10 years at Pearson researching the impact of professional development on teacher practice and student outcomes. She also headed up international impact evaluation studies for K12 at Pearson. Before Pearson, she spent a few years at one of the Regional Educational Labs and a small edtech consulting firm conducting program evaluations of various technology initiatives. Her Ph.D. and M.A. are in education from UCLA and her B.A. is in psychology and statistics from the University of Pittsburgh.

Kim

Kim Merrill

Kimberly Merrill

Senior Content Creator, Computer Science

Kim came to Khan Academy by way of Google, where she led teams in Google Cloud and Google Maps, and by way of Khan Academy itself, where she once worked as a software engineer!

She discovered programming in college only because she profoundly didn't want to take a math class, and to graduate, the intro to computer science class was the only alternative. She is excited to build engaging, approachable content to reach learners who similarly might not have considered computer science as an option for them.

In her spare time, Kim teaches dance fitness, bakes things, and attempts to make good use of Seattle's great outdoors.

Kristen

Kristen DiCerbo

Chief Learning Officer

Kristen DiCerbo, Ph.D. is the chief learning officer at Khan Academy. In this role, she is responsible for driving and communicating the learning strategy for Khan Academy’s programs, content, and product to realize deep engagement and better learning outcomes. She leads the content and product management teams, ensuring pedagogical coherence and a research-informed design across Khan Academy’s offerings.

Prior to coming to Khan Academy, Kristen was the vice-president of learning research and design at Pearson. Throughout her career she has focused on conducting and embedding learning science research into digital learning experiences, including work with the Cisco Networking Academy. She also served as a school psychologist in an Arizona school district.

Kristen has a B.A. in psychology and sociology from Hamilton College and an M.Ed. and Ph.D. in educational psychology from Arizona State University.

Lafeesah

STEM Content Creator

Lafeesah is a STEM Content Creator who is excited to bring the the joy of learning into this work. She brings nine years of experience teaching middle school in Philadelphia and looks forward to using that experience to inform her practice. Her love of learning and her desire to foster curiosity is what drives her in this work.

When Lafeesah is not working on content, she enjoys reading and going on adventures with her son (him leading, of course). Her mind often gets consumed with how and why things are, so she sometimes succumbs to rabbit holes of simple research.

Lan

Lan Borg

Senior Product Designer

Lan is a Senior Product Designer for the teacher and reports experience. She loves what she does and doing it with a group of amazing people is even better. Prior to Khan Academy, she has helped lead design for core products, build teams, and improve workflows. When she's not busy caring for her little humans, you can find her gardening, going for a long walk, or just contemplating our role in this big universe!

Laurie

Director of Community Support

Laurie is a nerd for online communities, and at Khan Academy gets to work with one of the internet's finest.

Before Khan Academy, Laurie helped internal teams make sense of the strange and wonderful weirdness of internet communities at various gaming and social media startups. When she's not geeking out over the amazing ways that humans interact online, she can be found exploring some part of the world trying to collect good stories.

Lorraine

Program Manager

Lorraine is a program manager for Khan Academy Kids specializing in social media marketing and customer support for the Khan Academy Kids community.

Lorraine has spent 10 years in the field of children's educational apps as a tech blogger and marketer. She's delighted to support Khan Academy Kids - the world's best educational app for kids. In her spare time, she parents two teen girls and spends as much time as possible in the local mountains - sun, rain, or snow!

Luke

Sr. Engineering Manager

Luke is working with the Learner Experience team to make the learning experience fun to use and easy to navigate around. Prior to coming to Khan Academy, Luke worked as a frontend web developer and Engineering leader at several companies across many industries. He was a core contributor to the YUI JavaScript library. These days, he focuses on collaborating with, coaching, and mentoring engineers, managers, and leaders of all types.

Maggie

Margaret

Software Engineer

Maggie is a software engineer on the Data Infrastructure team at Khan Academy. She has a background in Backend Development and DevOps, but is an admirer of all well written code and beautifully designed infrastructure. She is passionate about learning and loves working for an organization like Khan Academy!

When Maggie isn’t coding she loves wandering around outside, reading too many books at once, and lounging with her cats.

Maggie

Software Engineer

Maggie is a part of the amazing Tutor Platform team at Khan Academy. She went to UC San Diego for computer science and recently graduated March 2024. She was a summer intern at Khan Academy in 2023 and worked on awesome projects with the Content Platform team. In her free time, she loves to find Tiktok recipes and try to make them with the family, plan weekend getaways, and take scenic photos.

Mansi

Operations Specialist

Mansi joined Khan Academy India team in April 2018 as an Operations Specialist. Prior to Khan Academy, she has served as an Executive Assistant in the higher education sector for 8 years where she honed her skills in operations and event management, cross-departmental coordination, and helped in building organizational culture. In her free time, she likes to study culture as a concept and how it encompasses the range of human phenomena that cannot be attributed to genetic inheritance.

Mark

Software Engineer

Mark has always enjoyed learning, teaching and empowering others. Before joining Khan Academy, he designed and built software at companies such as Apple, TestFlight and Mobify. Mark is the creator of Factory Boy, a popular testing framework for Python, and has been published by the American Institute of Physics. He holds a BA in Applied Mathematics from the University of California, Berkeley.

When not at his computer, you will often find Mark hiking, biking or climbing.

Mason

Engineering Manager, Teacher Experience

Mason is an engineering leader and former teacher based in Hillsborough, North Carolina. He has worked in software engineering for longer than he should probably admit, and has taught in high school, university, and code schools. Beyond work, he enjoys time with his family (spouse and three boys!), outdoor activities like hiking, reading on a wide variety of topics, and playing all kinds of video and board games.

Melissa

Principal, HR Program and Project Management

Melissa joined Khan Academy in 2024 as a member of our People Operations team working to create a positive, supportive, and frictionless experience for Khan Academy's employees.

Prior to joining Khan Academy, Melissa held roles in HR and operations in tech and K-12 public education, spending many years as a school operations director in charter schools in New York City.

Now based in Atlanta, Melissa is originally from Cincinnati and is a pet parent to a dog and a cat. She spends time traveling, exploring national parks, baking, and planning her next DIY home decorating project.

Michael

Quality Engineer

Michael joins the team as a Quality Engineer having been a web and mobile automation engineer for several years prior. He has automated hundreds of tests for dozens of products and enjoys seeing green results. He has had a passion for teaching and learning since he was in elementary school and is excited to be able to contribute to that mission at Khan Academy.

In his free time, Michael has many hobbies including (but not limited to): playing the guitar, drums, 3d printing, photography, and videography - and enjoying/making memes. If given the opportunity, he would probably eat cheeseburgers every day.

Mita

Senior QA Engineer

Mita is excited to join the engineering team at Khan Academy where she will focus on tools, infrastructure, automation and quality. Prior to KA, Mita has spent several years in the tech industry at Mentor Graphics, HP, Yahoo, Symantec and a start-up called Fireclick (aka Digital River). Mita has a Masters in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Rutgers University.

Mita is passionate about education and in her spare time likes to teach young children to code. She has been the co-coach of her son’s Robotic’s team for the past 5 years.

Mita loves to cook (only gourmet and preferably desserts!, exploring the world with her family and attending concerts - Lady Gaga, Sting, JT, Pink Flyod being her favorite ones.

Molly

Senior Talent Acquisition Partner

Molly is a Senior Talent Acquisition Partner on the People Operations team. She has the fortune of speaking to hundreds (if not thousands) of interesting humans eager to apply their skills to the mission of Khan Academy. Before stepping into the role, she worked in HR and talent at Harvard Business School Online and City Year.

In her spare time, Molly likes to listen to podcasts, take long walks with her pack, and find really good deals on things she doesn't need.

Natália De Nadai

Brazil Math Content Creator

Before Khan Academy, Natália worked teaching math to students of a Foundation in Brazil, she graduated in Physics and Mathematics at Unicamp, one of the most renowned universities in Brazil. Passionate about people, education and technology she always seeks to unite these passions and at Khan Academy this is possible.

Outside of work, Natália likes to spend her time with family and friends and she is always looking for the next travel destination.

Nick

Nicholas

Nick Kokkinis

Nicholas Kokkinis

Kokkinis

Content Creator, STEM

Nick is passionate about math, and a lifelong learner. Prior to Joining Khan Academy, he worked in education for the last 10 years, primarily as a one-on-one tutor with students all over the world.

When not writing STEM content, Nick co-runs a small art gallery. He loves to see exhibitions, go for outdoor runs, spend time at the beach, and explore New York City—where he was born and continues to live.

Odelia

Sr. Financial Analyst

Odelia is super excited to be part of the Finance Team to help make sure all transactions, big and small, are accounted for accurately. Prior to joining Khan Academy, she was also working in finance at PG&E and Gap Inc.

Outside of work, Odelia enjoys reading, traveling to exotic and unexplored places, learning new things, visiting cute card and paper shops, admiring the color changes in leaves during fall season, and attending basketball games. She also volunteers at a mentorship program monthly to hopefully inspire and guide students to take charge of their learning.

Paul

CTO and VP Engineering

Paul Morgan serves Khan Academy as CTO and VP Engineering. He is responsible for overseeing the technical direction and implementation and data insights team.

During the past 30 plus years, Paul has proven himself as an innovations catalyst in roles of CTO, Chief Architect and engineering leader. He has founded several companies building consumer facing web applications, serving them in technical executive roles culminating in IPO preparation and acquisition as well as serving as a strategist and change agent in established enterprise companies. At Intuit he was Chief Architect of Hosting and led the transition to private and public clouds.

Paul joined Khan Academy in 2017 as Director of Engineering to lead Infrastructure to ensure that the site runs really well and learners can count on it being available. Over the past two years he has additionally been leading our Goliath services transformation work. He is thrilled and honored to have this opportunity to work more closely with the product teams and to get back to building inspiring, efficacious and engaging product.

When not working with computers he pursues his passion of Squash, Windsurfing, 3D printing and flying Paramotors!

Rachel

Chief of Staff

Rachel Boroditsky is passionate about improving educational equity and excited to support Khan Academy as Chief of Staff. In this role, Rachel is accountable for driving the strategic planning process, providing strategic and operational support to the CEO, senior leadership team, and Board, and supporting special projects.

Prior to joining Khan Academy, Rachel was a manager at McKinsey & Company, where she worked with higher education institutions and systems on strategic and operational initiatives, and worked at a literacy and numeracy NPO, where she managed the implementation of tablet-based learning programs in Malawi. Rachel has a B.A. in economics and mathematical methods in the social sciences from Northwestern University. In her free time, Rachel loves hiking and spending time with her partner and their 12 year old chihuahua, Taco.

Renee

Southeast Regional Senior Sales Manager

Renee is a California native currently holding a North Carolina driver's license. After working in the classroom with middle school students, she transitioned to the edtech space working at McGraw-Hill, the Museum of Science, Boston, & IXL before joining the Khan Academy team. Renee is currently working to bring equitable access of Khan Academy content to districts across the southeast. In her free time, she is a mom-taxi to her two children while being in a constant search for the next best restaurant or place for her family to explore!

Sam

Sam Mende-Wong

Email Marketing Manager

Sam is the child of a journalist and a community organizer. Early on, he recognized the importance of connection and the power of a good story. Throughout his career, he has sought to connect people to the right stories to improve their lives.

Sam loves thoughtful strategy, clean data, sharp copy, and good humor. He strives to lead with compassion and humanity.

📍: Oakland, CA

🎵: Breakdown by Mariah Carey ft Krayzie Bone & Wish Bone

Sam

Sam Hays

Senior Software Engineer

Sam is a senior software engineer, proud to be working in the team responsible for keeping Khan Academy safe. He has a broad set of experiences in many verticals (manufacturing, entertainment, technology, retail) which inform his security worldview.

Outside of KA, Sam is an instructor of cyber-security at Vanderbilt University and is working to finish a PhD in Computer Science. During his free time, he loves spending time with his family, reading, and playing the piano.

Sandeep

India Country Manager

Sandeep heads Khan Academy in India and dreams of providing every kid an equal chance in life.

Prior to Khan Academy, Sandeep spent several years at IFC investing in companies in Asia, Africa, Latin America and Europe. He later founded an edtech startup that created communities for online learners in more than 80 countries, many more than he has traveled to.

Sandi

Controller

Sandi leads the accounting and compliance team at Khan Academy. She is a strong believer in the power of education to change lives. A first-generation college graduate, Sandi holds a master's degree in accounting from North Carolina State University and a certificate in nonprofit management from Duke University. She is also a licensed Certified Public Accountant (CPA) and a Certified Global Management Accountant (CGMA).

In her free time, Sandi enjoys traveling, playing flute and practicing yoga.

Sara

Roster Operations

Sara works on the District Success team helping district partners set up and sync their rosters so teachers and students can easily access their Khan Academy accounts.

Sara spent eight years as a classroom teacher and brings her experiences of using technology in the classroom to her work with district partners.

Sarah

Senior Product Designer, Platform Accessibility

Sarah has a background in UX, product design, front-end development and designing for accessibility. She has a passion for learning how things are designed and built with accessibility in mind, and loves to bridge both worlds. She was born in England and came to the U.S. when she was a kid (7)! So, she still enjoys a good Cadbury’s chocolate bar. Her and her family are based in Groton, CT. They enjoy all the seasons in New England! You can find her walking in the woods with her dog Gingerbread, digging in the sand at the beach with her son, swimming at her in-laws pool, making blackberry jam in August, experimenting with making kombucha, escaping to Maine all year round (her favorite vacay spot), or drinking hot chocolate near the wood stove in the winter!

Sarah

Quality Engineer II

Sarah believes in lifelong learning. She earned an MA in English at Tennessee Technological University and taught college English in both the US and Asia prior to her career as a quality engineer. She is thrilled to continue supporting education through attention to detail in quality engineering at Khan Academy.

Sarah enjoys hiking, reading all the exhibit signs in museums, singing, and playing cooperative survival crafting computer games.

Sean

Software Engineer

Sean's ridiculously excited to be working on education technology. He's been a security developer, an animation-tools specialist, a full-time traveler, a studious six-year-old, and a student at the University of Waterloo, in no particular order.

When he's not coding, he's probably seeking out nature, taking photos, cooking, or playing guitar.

Shawn

Shawn Jansepar

Director of Engineering, Learning Platform

Shawn first developed a passion for education by watching Sal's TED talk, which led him to become a TA at a coding bootcamp and teaching a course on Web Application Development at Simon Fraser University. Coming full circle, he now leads a team of Engineers building amazing education software for learners around the world!

Prior to joining Khan Academy, Shawn led Engineering at Mobify in Vancouver, growing it from a tiny startup to a large 100+ person team which was eventually acquired by Salesforce. When he's not building products, Shawn likes to go cycling, play hockey & video games, try new plant-based food, and travel! He received his Bachelors in Computing Science from Simon Fraser University.

Shuchi

HRBP

Shuchi loves all things humanity so thought it was a good idea to get into Human Resources. She looks after (with a lot of love & care) our India employees, leading the HR function for Khan Academy India. She is an engineer with an MBA in Human Resources. She has worked in multiple industries such as automobile, oil & energy, healthcare and finally found her fam at Khan Academy.

She loves all things arts (even as she is as good at arts as Stephan King is at Romantic Comedies!). In free & in busy times, she loves reading books, arguing about the state of world affairs and wondering about the meaning of life.

Six

Michelle Six

Engineering Manager

As the daughter of a mad scientist, Six feels it's her mission to bring order to chaos while spreading fun. A long time Silicon Valley veteran, she's worked at diverse companies from Apple to Napster.

In her spare time, Six enjoys writing science fiction, making video games, and writing short autobiographies in the third person.

Stephanie

Senior Manager Social Media

Stephanie loves all things social media and online community. She leads the social team that brings out the joy for Khan Academy's virbant community of learners, teachers, and parents.✨

She gets to tell stories for her day job. Reads stories for leisure. Finds stories by exploring with her husband and their big, floofy dog.

Steve

Senior Software Engineer

Steve is a full stack developer working on the districts and rostering team. He brings an infectious enthusiasm, a commitment to continual learning, an empathic orientation, and a breadth of technical experience. He strives to make a safe, accessible environment, where everyone is appreciated for their contributions and can reach their full potential. Since building software is an inherently communicative art, he strongly believes sprinkling in bad puns makes for better software [citation needed]. Before coming to Khan Academy, he worked at JSTOR and the University of Michigan.

Outside of work, he has three wonderful kids and a room full of board games.

Sujata

Engineering Director

Sujata comes to Khan Academy after many years developing and managing software initiatives in fintech. She helps the Coaching & Coached Learning engineering team work on creating new, impactful ways for teachers and students to use Khan Academy in the classroom.

Outside of work you will find her at local famers markets or hiking one of the many glorious Bay Area trails!

Sydney

Design Manager

Sydney is the Design Manager for the Learner Experience team at Khan Academy. Prior to joining the team, Sydney was a product designer and leader for organizations big and small, in multiple industries such as ecommerce, finance, and insurance.

She loves exploring big ideas, untangling complex challenges, and working with teammates to use design for positive change. Outside of work, you can find her hiking in the woods, reading a book, or trying out a new hobby.

Tamara

Software engineer

Tamara arrived at Khan Academy via an internship arranged by Ada Developers Academy, a one year software developer bootcamp. Before that, she worked on Interlibrary Loan and Acquisitions at an academic library. Moving from the West Coast to the East Coast was a big change, but she enjoys the snowy weather and beautiful trees on this side of the States. Some of her hobbies include video/board/tabletop games, anime, learning Japanese, reading fantasy/sci-fi books, and baking/cooking.

Tim

Timothy

Tim McCabe

Timothy McCabe

Software Engineer II

Tim is a full-stack dev and a graduate of the University of Cincinnati, who now lives in Columbus with their wife and cat. They enjoy making music (🎤🎸), playing video games (mostly indie titles and Nintendo games), helping with animal rescue (🐕🐈), and brewing coffee (usually iced). As a lifelong lover of learning and a longtime advocate for nonprofit organizations, they could not be more excited to write software for Khan Academy!

Tony

Senior Software Engineer

Tony is a web engineer on the Learning Platform team. His passion for education has led him to Khan Academy where he now helps deliver personalized experiences for learners everywhere!

When he isn’t building software, you may find him sketching, fiddling with photography, binge watching shows, or having the time of his life at the nearest Disney theme park.

Victoria

District Success Manager

Victoria has supported students one-on-one and is now grateful to be supporting districts across the US with the implementation of Khan Academy. She currently lives in the San Francisco Bay Area where she loves to go cycling and running. She has a B.S. in Chemical Engineering from the University of Texas at Austin (hook 'em, horns!) and wants to bring her love of learning, math, and science to learners!

Wieteke

Biology Content Creator

Wieteke develops videos, articles, and exercises for biology-related content at Khan Academy. She is especially passionate about ecology and environmental science (and, of course, birds!). Her goal is to make biology (and all of science!) fun, approachable, relevant, and engaging for anyone and everyone.

In addition to her work at Khan Academy, Wieteke is pursuing a PhD at the University of Tennessee. She is studying the ecological impacts of invasive house mouse population on islands and how to inform successful conservation interventions. With over a decade of field experience, Wieteke has extensive knowledge of wildlife monitoring, invasive species management, and restoration ecology.

Zachary

Software Engineer

Zachary is a software engineer who loves solving hard problems and learning new things. They are excited to contribute to the Khan Academy mission by joining the test prep team.

When not coding, Zachary is playing music, designing games, searching for the best slice of pizza, and enjoying the now.

Alexander Mango Flexer

CTO (Chewy Toy Obliterator)

Alexander Mango Flexer, aka Sandy, performs double duty at Khan Academy Kids. He keeps the founders and their kids sane during the day, by providing much needed affection and entertainment. At night, he designs and implements most of the Khan Kids functionality, happily giving credit to his owners who can barely tie their shoe laces.

His father is the famed Australian labrador architect Atoni Daugi, while his mother is the platinum-selling hip-hopping poodle Beyonce Growles.

Alfie

Official Treat Tester

As the Official Treat Tester, Alfie takes pride in making sure that each treat is high quality and tasty. He even tests each treat several times before giving them the stamp of approval. He’s very detail oriented and thorough! Alfie also likes to check in with his teammates and go on walks to get exercise during the workday.

When Alfie is not in the office, he is making new friends, going on hikes, enjoying time in his backyard, and snoozing.

Barcelona

Leader of the Pack

Barcelona AKA in the San Francisco dog parks as “Barci”, is half German Shepherd and half Siberian Husky. She likes to think she’s the Alpha of the #khanofficedogs. During the week you can find her underneath the desk of our Video Manager, kindly accepting belly scratches and giving hi-fives in return. On the weekends, she’s dragging her human through Golden Gate Park, chasing squirrels. She swears she’s gonna get one, one of these days!

Barry

Barry from EastEnders

Bazzer

Chief Opurrating Officer

Barry From EastEnders works with Jeff from their Austin, Texas home. Barry ensures that important operational tasks are not forgotten, including but not limited to treat distribution, water fulfillment, and occupational therapy time. He also makes it a priority to check for cable manufacturing flaws through extensive chew tests, requesting that Jeff practice his sofa fort building, and overseeing all kitchen operations from his favourite stool. His office includes a sofa fort, space on Jeff’s shoulders, and Jeff’s lap.

Bochi

The doted son of the Liu Family

Hi, I'm Bochi! I'm the coolest dog on the street. I love stealing my family's shoes and chewing on them. It's funny when they get noisy and chase me. I also like chasing cats, squirrels, birds, and butterflies. Anything that moves requires my investigation. I have a very understandable disdain for baths. It takes away my au naturel scent.

Daisy

Daisy Ban

Loyal Coworker and Couch Potato

Hi, I'm Daisy! I am a rescue pit bull who had a hard start in life but is now living it up with plenty of couches to lie on and oodles of peanut butter-filled Kong toys. I will eat absolutely anything and everything, and I am a champion cuddler!

Hildie

Rescue Dog Ambassador

Hildie lives in Houston with her adoring pawrents, tolerant cat siblings, and occasional foster dog sibling. She splits her day between the dog bed and the human bed, advising on important issues such as whether it’s time for her walk and if it’s a good day to bask in the sun. She aspires to bring a smile to everyone she meets, and her dream is to be a spokesdog for rescue pets everywhere. Hildie enjoys travel, yoga (specifically, laying down on as much of the mat as possible), and learning new skills…but only because of the treats.

Loki

Handsome Rogue

Loki was found as an abandoned puppy in a box in Northern Quebec. When his Guardians adopted him from the shelter, he was a very anxious boy. With lots of love, training and hard work, he has grown into a very calm and mature dog - though he does still like to be a bit mischievous.

Phryne

Chief Engineer, Adventures

Phryne, named for a character from Australian television, is a cattle dog/Catahoula mix who enjoys ADVENTURES. At Khan Academy, she heads up our Washington Bureau, leading teammates on long excursions into Rock Creek Park, from the Capitol Ruins to Peirce Mill. Possessed of inexhaustible energy, she always wants to explore, encouraging our learners and her reports to push themselves to discover new things and places.

In addition to running through the woods, exploring D.C., and barking at lobbyists, Phryne enjoys the art of the snug, and is learning to play what she thinks is football. She would love to meet you.

Shadow

Purr Programmer

Shadow works with Nick at Khan Academy as a purr programmer. Shadow also ensures sustainable working practices through investing in breaks that involve lots of petting or playing a game of chase the laser.

Shadow models excellent sustainable behavior by thinking through hard problems with a good nap followed by a casual stroll around the house.

Smokey

Chief Purrformance Analyst

Smokey is Khan Academy’s Chief Purrformance Analyst, making sure that laps stay warm and treats get eaten. When he’s not making conference call cameos, he’s sleeping on the bed, sleeping on the window seat, or sitting perfectly still in Lilli’s lap as she’s working, happy to keep her company as she codes.

In his spare time, he likes to chase strings and beg for snacks. If he’s feeling ultra-mellow, you can find him sitting quietly, keeping an ever-watchful, unflagging eye on the snack drawer. A stoic fella in his older years, he will gladly welcome pets from anyone, any time, hardly moving an inch from wherever he may be lazing, and never, ever scratching or biting.

Zacy

Zacian Valdez

Trainer

Zacy, Napper and Foot Warmer. Zacy is a master of snoozing and snuggling, and never misses a chance to join Elly, our content creator, at her desk. She is also a fan of Pokemon, and was named after the legendary Zacian. She enjoys long walks, car rides, and exploring new places, like Pikes Peak, where she posed for this epic photo.
